connector.description: Synthesize speech from text using AWS Polly.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.voiceId.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.voiceId
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.voiceId.description: The voice ID to use for speech synthesis (e.g., Joanna, Matthew, Amy, Brian).

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.outputForma.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.outputFormat
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.outputForma.description: The audio format in which the resulting stream will be encoded.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.textType.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.textType
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.textType.description: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.engine.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.engine
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.engine.description: Specifies the engine (standard, neural, long-form, generative) for Amazon Polly to use when processing input text for speech synthesis.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.languageCod.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.languageCode
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.languageCod.description: Optional language code for voice synthesis. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useDefaultC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useDefaultC.description: If true, the Polly client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useProfileC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useProfileC.description: Set whether the Polly client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useSessionC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.useSessionC.description: Set whether the Polly client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in a situation in which the user needs to assume an IAM role for doing operations in Polly.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.profileCred.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.profileCred.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter sets the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.sessionToke.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.sessionToke.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume an IAM role.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.uriEndpoint.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.uriEndpoint.description: The overriding endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also select the `overrideEndpoint` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.overrideEnd.name: camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-polly-sink.overrideEnd.description: Select this option to override the endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also provide a URI for the `uriEndpointOverride` option.
